# Bespoke Worksurface and Washroom Specialists
Celebrating 31 years established
Expertly fabricating & installing solid surfaces in kitchens, bathrooms and commercial settings nationwide
[Residential](http://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/residential/)[Commercial](http://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/commercial/)
## More than just surface value
Solid surface materials are both versatile and visually appealing. They can be joined almost seamlessly, making them the ideal choice when it comes to elegant worktops that are also easy to maintain. They can be shaped into unique, curved designs with a continuous form, making them perfect for creative projects ‚Äì both commercial and residential.
More than just a manufacturer of products, Solid Surfacing Company are a team of professional, friendly people ready to make your vision a reality. We‚Äôre passionate about what we do and take pride in every project, adding our own personal touch to everything we do.
[Get a quote](http://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/contact/)
## Take a tour of our showroom and factory
## Get started
If you‚Äôd like to know more about our services, get in touch. We‚Äôd be more than happy to talk you through our products and process.
## Our services
For Solid Surfacing Company, no project is too big or small. We manufacture solid surface, compact-grade laminate and hardwood products for both individuals and large-scale clients, providing any necessary advice and design help along the way.
Once you contact us, we will provide you with a free, no-obligation quote. Once you accept the quote, we then go on to produce industry-standard CAD drawings for your project. Our processes also support using your own designs and drawings, often acquired by architects and existing designers.
Our dedicated team create a template before manufacturing your solid surface products, all tailored to your individual requirements. Our installation team can then fit your bespoke solid surface products with precision and finesse.
### [ResidentialResidentialWhether you are looking for beautiful, solid surface worktops for your kitchen, bathroom or home bar, Solid Surfacing Company has the solution. We can make custom moulded products to keep your home looking sleek and modern. Our manufacturing services also offer unique products like home bars and other bespoke, conceptual furniture, fixtures and fittings that complete a room.](https://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/residential/)
### [CommercialCommercialFrom deli and reception counters to school and airport furniture, Solid Surfacing Company has made it all. We have worked with offices, cinemas, shops, bars and restaurants to provide custom products, including backlit neon signs and customised safari lodge kitchens. With vast experience across a range of sectors, our solid surface solutions offer a hygienic, durable, and made-to-measure result.](https://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/commercial/)
### [WashroomsWashroomsWith almost thirty years‚Äô experience in the industry, our expert team can adapt to your exact specifications and room requirements. We can create solid surface washroom cubicle partitions at full or custom height and also complement our washroom cubicles with solid surface sinks, wash troughs, vanity units and IPS panels, all of which can be matched to your chosen aesthetic.](https://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/commercial/washrooms/)
## Why choose Solid Surfacing Company?
Whether you are upgrading your home or need a large-scale, commercial solution, you want a company you can trust. Solid Surfacing Company is passionate about every project we complete and pride ourselves on being a company that you can trust.
As a family company, our customer service is second to none and matched by the quality and outstanding results that we produce. Our friendly and professional service begins with an enquiry and concludes with a product that exceeds expectations. Rest safe in the knowledge that we have over thirty years of experience transforming solid surface materials into custom products.
[Get a quote](http://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/contact/)
## Brands we work with
## Our unique success stories
One of the best things about the solid surface materials we work with is that they can be moulded into literally any shape. This has allowed us to create unique, out-of-the-box solutions for a range of clients. For instance, we created the neon signs for Wasabi Sushi & Bento and also made the long, elegant tables found at Yo! Sushi in London.
From custom home bars to quirky airport counters, Solid Surfacing Company has experience with an array of unique projects. Learn more about our most unique project which was a recreation of the famous washroom from the blockbuster film, The Shining.
### [New worktops: From Template to Installation](https://solidsurfacingcompany.co.uk/case-studies/new-worktops-from-template-to-installation/)

scraped_results.title: About Us | Who we are | Solid Surfacing
scraped_results.markdown_content:
# A family-run company committed to its customer
Solid Surfacing Company is a family-run business, owned and operated by the Reid family: Bill, Jill, Rachel and John. We are based in Kidderminster and have been in the industry since 1994.
Our family company manufactures bespoke, high-quality products for both residential homes and large commercial clients across the UK. Bill and John in particular have had a lifetime‚Äôs worth of experience in the surface production industry. As the largest solid surfacing manufacturer in the Midlands, we have an unrivalled knowledge, which enables us to offer each customer the highest possible standard of service, from the manufacture to the supply of all types of work surface.
Since our company‚Äôs foundation, we have aimed to provide bespoke, specialist counters and washrooms on a nationwide basis. We strive to produce only the highest quality work and provide only the best in customer service ‚Äì to both residential homeowners and commercial property owners alike.
## Our story
The journey began with Bill, who has been working in the industry since 1987. Bill has since grown the company into what it is today. With hard work, perseverance and help from those around him, he created a strong, reliable company, whilst truly preserving the family-run nature of the business. In 2007, John (now Managing Director) joined the business, adding his own experience with large-scale clients to the mix, in addition to managing commercial sales and overall production.
John‚Äôs wife Rachel recently joined in June 2022 and works as an administrator, focussing particularly on business development and retail sales.
As a true family-operated business, we offer a much more personal service on every project, with our customers forming the heart of our business. Indeed, our company ethos is to ensure both excellent customer service and top-quality products. Solid Surfacing Company has been trading for almost thirty years and has built an outstanding reputation in the commercial and residential surfacing world.
Bill‚Äôs wife, Jill, joined in 2012. After a long and successful career in law, she now applies her expertise by handling all the company‚Äôs contracts and administrative affairs, including employment law and H&S.
Their daughter, Alexandra, also joined the family business in 2010. She now, acts as marketing consultant to guarantee the success of Solid Surfacing Company. Meanwhile, their nephew, Andrew, is the Production Manager who is responsible for ensuring that jobs run like clockwork from the moment the order is placed, through the factory process, and on to delivery and installation.
From initial enquiry through to completion, our experience and commitment ensure that your contract ‚Äì no matter how big or small ‚Äì is handled professionally. We always endeavour to complete our work as cost-effectively as possible, working to your budget, your brief and your deadlines throughout each stage of the project.
## Introducing our showroom
In 2019, we opened a stunning new showroom in Kidderminster. Fully furnished with our own unique creations, it‚Äôs the perfect place to discover what we can do. Whether you want to visit to speak to our designers, take a look at our examples or request samples to help you choose the right solid surface, we highly recommend a visit. You can even watch us manufacture some of our bespoke products to get a better idea of the passion and care we put into our projects.
## Our enquiry process
With almost thirty years of experience in the industry, Solid Surfacing Company offers a bespoke service, allowing us to tailor our products to your individual requirements. We give expert advice, offer free quotes and ‚Äì once these quotes have been accepted ‚Äì produce industry-standard CAD drawings and manufacture your order within our factory premises to your exact specifications. All templating, manufacturing and installation is carried out by our experienced joinery and fabrication team.
From the moment you make your initial enquiry, we strive to make you feel completely at ease and aim to cater to your every need.
We encourage clients to visit our showroom where possible, as this will allow you to view our extensive range of products, samples and various surfacing options in finer detail. We even invite customers to come to watch the manufacturing processes live. Whether for informative or entertainment purposes, this will be a memorable experience all the same.
## The team
Solid Surfacing Company now has over twenty employees and treats each and every one of them like a member of the family. We pride ourselves on working together as a team to achieve the best results in every project that we take on. Our friendly and helpful staff in all departments are more than happy to be of assistance.
### CAD
We have a dedicated CAD team led by Andrew ‚Äì another member of the family. The team‚Äôs extensive design knowledge and experience come together to bring our customers‚Äô drawings to life, guaranteeing that they capture their vision perfectly.
They also operate and programme our CNC machinery, which is used for our more technically challenging fabrications. This is in addition to managing the company‚Äôs stock. Andrew, Kurt and Dominic form an incredibly capable team whose work is central to our business.
### Fabrication
Solid Surfacing Company simply wouldn‚Äôt exist without the sheer hard work and dedication of our fabrication team.
Adam, Chris, Mark, Gareth, Callum, Chris, Nick and trainee Dominic continue to make the company the success story that it is today and constantly strive for innovation and improvement. The team also ensures that our reputation for top-quality work is always upheld on every project we work on.
## Enquire now
If you'd like to know more about how we can help you with your projects, please drop us an email, give us a call or fill out our contact form.
If you already have technical drawings/CADs, then you can even drag and drop these to send across to us too. We would love to hear from you!
## Our happy customers
Shirley Davies
Thank you for the truly amazing way that your company dealt with my disaster. I have no words to describe the horror of looking down at my cracked Corian sink just two weeks ago. The efficiency and speed that was put so promptly into place to help me overcome my catastrophe will always stay in my mind.

# About
The Jordon Group
## Experts in shopfitting & refrigeration  since 1965
For over 60 years, The Jordon Group has been a trusted partner in shopfitting, refrigeration, and air conditioning ‚Äì delivering specialist solutions to businesses across the UK and beyond. What began as a small family business has grown into a nationally recognised name, built on a reputation for quality, reliability, and genuine customer care.
Our continued success is fuelled by innovation, efficiency, and a hands-on approach to service. From independent retailers to global brands, we tailor every solution to meet our clients‚Äô unique needs ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a complete commercial fit-out, bespoke refrigeration system, or cutting-edge energy-saving technology.
While we‚Äôve expanded and evolved over the decades, our core values remain the same. Since 1965, we‚Äôve taken pride in delivering expert workmanship, personal service, and lasting results ‚Äì project after project.
Our history
[ Meet the team ](https://jordon.co.uk/meet-the-team/)
## Our history:
## Our Roots
Founded in 1965 by Edward Jordon, E Jordon (Refrigeration) Ltd began life in a former co-op building in Oldham. From the start, the company was built on strong values: craftsmanship, reliability, and a personal approach. By 1971, a key partnership was formed with Italian refrigeration giant Arneg, laying the foundation for long-standing international collaboration. Paul Jordon, Edward‚Äôs son, qualified as a refrigeration engineer in 1985 and joined the company full time- marking the next generation of leadership. By 1990, the business had grown to a team of 28, with roles spanning engineering, joinery, sales, and admin.
## A Family Legacy Grows
The 1990s were a time of momentum. Paul Jordon became an associate member of the Institute of Refrigeration and took full control of the business as Managing Director in 1998. Two years later, Edward Jordon was honoured for 35 years of continued growth. In 2001, The Jordon Group name was officially adopted following the acquisition of Rock Refrigeration‚Äôs commercialdivision. Continued growth led to a move to larger premises in Manchester, and in 2007, the company relocated again- this time to our current 38,000 sq ft headquarters in Oldham.
## National Presence & Industry Recognition
By 2008, with 42 staff and national operations, The Jordon Group earned the Investors in People accreditation. Major milestones followed, including high-profile projects like Manchester Airport Terminal 2 and securing partnerships with major forecourt and retail operators. By 2012, turnover had hit ¬£11.5 million, enabling investment in vehicles, 3D CAD systems, forklifts, and smart racking. With a growing team and national reputation, the business had doubled its sales and joinery departments by 2010 and crossed ¬£20 million in turnover by 2016, with over 100 employees
## A Family Legacy Grows
## Expanding into New Markets
In 2017, we expanded into Europe with EG Group and began our long-standing relationship with Center Parcs‚Äîbeing shortlisted as their Supplier of the Year. In 2018, we transitioned toISO9001:2015 Quality Assurance Accreditation, reinforcing our commitment to excellence. When the COVID-19 pandemic struck in 2020, our team showed resilience and flexibility -continuing to support essential sectors and adapting to new ways of working. Through every challenge, our people-first culture remained central to how we operate.
## A New Chapter with Bellrock
In 2024, The Jordon Group proudly joined the Bellrock Group‚Äîan exciting new chapter that combines our family values with national scale. This partnership strengthens our capabilities while keeping the same personal touch that‚Äôs been with us since day one. Today, we employ over 140 people, turn over ¬£40 million annually, and continue to deliver fit-out, refrigeration, and HVAC services across the UK. From independent retailers to national brands, we remain dedicated to helping businesses stay efficient, compliant, and future-ready‚Äîwith quality, care, and integrity at the core of everything we do.

scraped_results.title: Liminal BioSciences - About Us
scraped_results.markdown_content:
# About Us
##  Who we are
Liminal BioSciences, through its wholly owned subsidiary, Caledon Bioscience Inc., is a data-driven development-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on discovering and developing novel and distinctive small molecule therapeutics that modulate G protein-coupled receptor pathways (GPCRs). We are designing proprietary novel small molecule therapeutic candidates with the intent of developing best/first in class therapeutics for the treatment of metabolic, inflammatory and fibrotic diseases with significant unmet medical needs, using our drug discovery and medicinal chemistry expertise and deep understanding of GPCR biology.
Our registered office is located in Belleville, Ontario and we have talent hubs in Quebec, Canada, and in the United Kingdom.
Liminal BioSciences is a privately held company owned by Structured Alpha LP (‚ÄúSALP‚Äù), a limited partnership managed by its general partner, Thomvest Asset Management Ltd.
##  GPCR‚Äôs: Compelling Biological Mechanisms
G proteins, also known as guanine nucleotide binding proteins, act as molecular switches inside cells and are involved in transmitting signals. GPCRs regulate numerous diverse physiological and pathological processes. Due to their abundance, broad distribution, and crucial involvement in cellular physiology and biochemistry, GPCRs represent the largest family of receptors in the human genome and hold significant importance in the development of therapeutics. Around 35% of all approved drugs target GPCRs, yet only around 16% of GPCR pathways have an approved drug, providing us with a significant opportunity for discovery and development of novel small molecule therapeutics for GPCR pathways.
All of our development programs target seven transmembrane GPCRs (7TM GPCR‚Äôs), where the receptor protein passes through the cell membrane seven times. These receptors are easily accessible to hydrophilic drugs due to their presence on the cell surface, and their non-uniform expression enables selectivity in modulating physiological processes. Agonists and antagonists of 7TM GPCRs receptors are utilized for treating various diseases in all organ systems. An agonist is a drug that binds to a target and mimics the action of the natural ligand. An antagonist is a drug that binds to a receptor and prevents other molecules (such as the natural ligand) from binding.

## Who Are We?
# ABOUT ABIMARA
## About Us
### A property company specialising in bespoke design-led projects
Originally established as a building contractor, Abimara specialised in high-end residential and listed properties. We grew purely by way of personal recommendation from clients, architects, and interior designers. Our unusual sensitivity to design and quality set us apart from many of our competitors.
Today we operate primarily as investors and developers. We believe buildings should enhance the environment in which they sit and create spaces that people enjoy living and working in.
Careful design and quality materials are key to all our projects. Every project is design-led, we do not do standard house types like many larger developers. Our approach to business is based on integrity and reliability. This has led to many strong and lasting relationships with trusted partners and suppliers across the industry.
### Testimonials

The units were incredibly well-designed, constructed to an exemplary standard and beautifully finished and were very, very popular with the purchasers. scraped_results.markdown_content:
Skip to content
## What We Do
# DEVELOPMENT, INVESTMENT, PROJECT MANAGEMENT
## What We Do
### Development - Including Design, Planning and Construction
As a developer we have undertaken a wide range of projects, including luxury one off houses, blocks of Ô¨Çats, ofÔ¨Åces, and mixed-use buildings. Our commitment to quality of design and construction remains core to our business.
Our development projects are always design-led to the highest quality standards, creating places that enhance the local environment and spaces in which people can enjoy living and working.
As well as outstanding architecture and high quality construction, we place signiÔ¨Åcant importance on planting and soft landscaping, which helps enhance the local environment on many levels. Generous planting schemes and green roofs often feature in our projects.
Energy efÔ¨Åciency and sustainability are also key components, which we achieve through a combination of air source heat pumps, photovoltaic solar panels, high insulation and designing for optimum solar gain.
### Investment
Our investment portfolio includes ofÔ¨Åces, warehouse, residential and retail properties. We have a proven track record of investing in commercial and residential property; we manage, maintain and optimise these assets whilst working to market conditions for best value.
Our investment portfolio also beneÔ¨Åts from our design and construction expertise so our portfolio includes beautifully designed and constructed workplaces and homes.
### Project Management & Consultancy
Our broad range of experience in design, construction, planning, development, and investment means we can offer a comprehensive project management or consultancy service for investors and property owners.
This includes but is not limited to:
* __ Sourcing opportunities
* __ Feasibility studies
* __ Gaining planning consents
* __ Raising debt Ô¨Ånance
* __ Managing the construction process
* __ Overall asset management
* __ Exit strategies
We have experience working within conservation areas, national parks, listed buildings, mixed-use buildings, constrained urban sites, and land promotion for larger strategic sites. We have excellent success rates for gaining planning consents, we have never had an application refused that we didn‚Äôt then win at appeal.
[ View Projects ](https://abimara.com/projects/)
Residential
Commerical
Residential
Our experience of residential property goes back to the 1970s. Our first projects were on behalf of homeowners and architects specialising in high end, often listed houses. Our sensitivity to design and conservation set us apart from our competitors.
Commerical
We have been investing in and constructing commercial property since the 1990s. The commercial spaces we create are always architect designed and make the most of natural light. We specialize in converting underutilised or outdated industrial premises into vibrant office space.

# New Forest Adventure Golf Course
* * *
#### First Visit to the Site
We were approached by The Lymington Golf Centre to supply and install their artificial grass for their new project: The New Forest Adventure Golf.
During our first visit we measured the site, met the team and discussed types of grass from our wide selection. Focusing on aesthetics and textures to suit the required putting surface for an adventure golf course, a choice for three different depths and weaves were chosen to reflect a natural and colourful appeal. Base layers chosen were type 1 mot, path topper 0-5mm dust and 2 layers of membrane.
We work within construction safety standards, have a full health and safety folder, have CSCS cards and are CIS Registered.
#### Second visit to the site
During our second visit we could see more progress and they lay out had started to take shape. Using the plans set out by the architect, we measured the site for the artificial grass, followed the plans to ensure each hole had the correct flow, and got to work.
#### Starting the process of lining and cutting the artificial turf
Contours and the roll of the ball were considered throughout, whilst making sure the grass is undulated and smooth.
All weather glues also ensure we can glue in wet weather, however, we were very pleased to have sunshine throughout the lay process.
#### Sunny weather ensures good progress
Great weather continues throughout the lay process.
Working alongside other trades to ensure the deadline was met. We met Gary Orange and his fantastic chainsaw carving expertise.
#### Progress
The course is staring to look like a golf course now. Encompassing three different grades of grass accentuates the undulations and the smoothness of the course.
With only a 2 week window, we completed all the greens.
#### The finished project
A beautiful high specification course, with challenging areas. Great for all the family. It was a pleasure to work with such a dedicated team and create a wonderful space for people and tourism in Lymington. The course has been designed to enhance peoples knowledge of the The New Forest, and every time we visit we can see new additions added to the course.
* * *

We collect the following data about you, which you provide to us:

* **Data and information relating to your personal devices** : we may collect information relating to your online identifiers (including IP address), device information and information about your visit to our website, lengths of visits to certain pages and page interaction information.
**3\. Cookies** What are Cookies? We collect information about your use of our Site through cookies. Cookies are information that files stored on your computer, tablet or smartphone that help websites remember who you are and information about your visit. Cookies can help to display the information on our Site in a way that matches your interests. Most major websites use cookies.
**a. What cookies are used on this Site?** The cookies we and our business partners use on our Site are broadly grouped into the following categories:
* **Essential** ‚Äì Some of the cookies on our Site are essential for us to be able to provide you with a service you have requested. An example of this could be a cookie used to enable you to log into your account on our Site or which allows communication between your browser and our Site. Our cookie preference cookie described in the section ‚ÄúHow can I reject or opt out of receiving cookies?‚Äù is also an essential cookie. You may not be able to use our Site without these cookies.
* **Analytics** ‚Äì We use analytics cookies to helps us understand how users engage with our Site. An example is counting the number of different people coming to our Site or using a particular feature, rather than the total number of times the site or feature is used. Without this cookie, if you visited our Site once each week for three weeks we would count you as three separate users. We would find it difficult to analyse how well our Site was performing and improve it without these cookies.
* **User Cookies** ‚Äì We use cookies to improve your experience by remembering your preferences so we know how you like to use our Site. Examples of this would be remembering you so that you are served with the same content or to remember you when you come back to our Site.
* **Social Sharing** ‚Äì We use third party cookies to allow you to share content directly on the social networking/sharing sites like Facebook, Twitter or Google+. Examples would be if you wanted to ‚Äúlike‚Äù or ‚Äútweet‚Äù about us or our products or services. Please see our ‚ÄúThird Party Cookies‚Äù section below for more details.
**b. How can I reject or opt out of receiving cookies?** You may refuse to accept cookies by activating the setting on your browser which allows you to refuse the setting of cookies. However, if you select this setting, you may be unable to access certain parts of our Site. Unless you have adjusted your browser setting so that it will refuse cookies, our system will issue cookies when you use our Site. The ‚ÄúHelp‚Äù menu of the toolbar on most browsers will tell you how to prevent your browser from accepting new cookies, how to have the browser notify you when you receive a new cookie, or how to disable cookies altogether. For more information about cookies and how to stop cookies being installed or how to delete existing cookies from your hard drive visit the following website: [https://www.allaboutcookies.org](https://www.allaboutcookies.org/).
**c. Third party cookies** Some of the cookies described in the ‚ÄúWhat Cookies are used on this Site‚Äù section above are stored on your machine by third parties when you use our Site. Third parties may also read cookies on your browser to collect information or to serve content or advertisements to you. We have no control over these cookies or how the third parties use them. They are used to allow that third party to provide a service to us, for example analytics. For more information on these cookies and how to disable them, please see:
* Internet Advertising Bureau website at <https://www.youronlinechoices.com/> where you will be able to opt-out of receiving Interest-Based Advertising cookies from some of the third parties listed below; and/or
* If you want to know more about how cookies work and how to manage or delete them, visit the [World Wide Web Consortium‚Äôs website](https://www.w3.org/Security/Faq/wwwsf2.html#CLT-Q10.).
**4\. How we use your personal data** We use your personal data for the purposes set out in the table below. In addition, data protection law requires us to only process your personal data if we satisfy one or more legal grounds. These are set out in data protection law. Our legal grounds for the processing we carry out are set out in the table below.
**Personal data categories** | **Purposes for processing** | **Legal grounds for processing**
---|---|---
Contact details  | **To provide you with the products and services you have requested** We use your personal data to accept you as a new or returning customer to provide you with the products and services you have requested in accordance with the Terms and Conditions of business.  | Necessary for the performance of a contract
Contact details and ID information  | We use your personal data to perform customer screening against sanction lists. | Necessary to comply with our legal obligations
Contact details and Correspondence | **To send you service communications, including in relation to changes to our Terms and Conditions of Business** We use the contact details you have provided to us so that we can communicate with you about the products and services that we provide, including to let you know about major changes to those products and services or to the Terms and Conditions between us or to any related information. | Necessary for the performance of a contract
Contact details  | **Direct marketing (including by third parties)** If you have provided your consent or we otherwise have the right to do so, we may use your contact details to send you direct marketing and keep you informed of promotional offers by email, SMS, post or telephone relating to our products and services or share your details with a third party business partner to allow them to market similar products and services to you. You can unsubscribe from our direct marketing at any time by clicking the ‚ÄúUnsubscribe‚Äù link in any of our emails or by contacting us. | Your consent where we are required to obtain this, or because it is necessary for our legitimate interest in marketing our business
Transaction details and Data and information relating to your personal devices  | **To track your usage of our website, communications, products and services** We use cookies and similar technologies to track your activity on our Site so that we can provide important features and functionality on our Site, monitor its usage, and provide you with a more personalised experienced. | Your consent
Contact details Correspondence and Transaction details  | **To provide and improve customer support** We use your personal data to be able to provide and improve the customer support we provide to you (for example, where you have questions about our products and services). | Necessary for our legitimate business interest in maintaining and improving our reputation
Contact details, Correspondence, Transaction Details and Data and information relating to your personal devices | **To maintain our records and improve data accuracy** Like any business, we process personal data in the course of maintaining and administering our internal records. This includes processing your personal data to ensure that the information we hold about you is kept up to date and accurate. | Necessary to comply with our legal obligations
Contact details, Correspondence, and Transaction details  | **To respond to enquiries, complaints and disputes** We use the personal data we hold about you to help us respond to any enquiries or complaints you have made, or deal with any dispute which may arise in the course of us providing our products and services to you, in the most effective manner. | Necessary to comply with our legal obligations and for our legitimate business interest in maintaining and improving our reputation
Contact details, Data and information relating to your personal devices, and Transaction details  | **To investigate, detect and prevent fraud and comply with our legal obligations** In certain circumstances, we use your personal data only to the extent required in order to enable us to comply with our legal obligations, including for fraud detection, investigation and prevention purposes. This may require us to provide your personal data to law enforcement agencies if they request it. | Necessary to comply with our legal obligations for our legitimate business interest in protecting our business.
Contact details and Correspondence  | For conducting market research. | Your consent
Contact details and Correspondence  | Obtaining your credit score so that we can establish the best possible payment terms we are able to offer to you. | Your consent
Correspondence and Transaction details  | Better understand our customer base so that we can improve our products and services and marketing activities (which could also benefit you) | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interest in growing our business
Transaction details  | Comply with our contractual obligations to third parties. | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interest in avoiding legal claims
Transaction details and Data and information relating to your personal devices | Develop and improve our Site to enhance the customer experience. | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interest in growing our business
Correspondence, Transaction details and Data and information relating to your personal devices  | Train our staff so that we can provide you with a better customer service. | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interests in retaining our customers and growing our business
Data and information relating to your personal devices | Ensure that content from our Site is presented in the most effective manner for you and for your computer. | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interests retaining our customers and growing our business
Contact details, Correspondence, Transaction details and Data and information relating to your personal devices  | Ensure effective operational management and internal administration of our business, document retention, compliance with regulatory guidance and exercise or defence of legal claims. | Necessary for the purposes of our legitimate business interests in avoiding legal or regulatory claims
If you choose not to give some or all of the aforementioned information to us, this may affect our ability to provide our products and services to you. In certain circumstances, we also use your personal data only to the extent required in order to enable us to comply with our legal obligations, including to detect, investigate and prevent fraud.
**6\. Who we share your personal data with** We may provide your personal data to our suppliers and service providers, including other companies in our group, who provide certain business services for us and act as ‚Äúprocessors‚Äù of your personal data on our behalf. In addition, we may disclose your personal data if we are under a duty to disclose or share your personal data in order to comply with any legal obligation, or in order to protect the rights, property, or safety, of our business, our customers or others. This includes, in specific cases, exchanging information with other organisations for the purposes of fraud protection. In some cases, the personal data we collect from you may, for the purposes set out above, be transferred outside United Kingdom and such destinations may not have laws which protect your personal data to the same extent as in the UK. We are required by data protection law to ensure that where we and our ‚Äúprocessors‚Äù transfer your personal data outside of the UK, it is treated securely and is protected against unauthorised access, loss or destruction, unlawful processing and any processing which is inconsistent with the purposes set out in this Privacy Notice.
**7\. How long we keep your personal data for** We retain your personal data for no longer than is necessary for the purposes(s) for which it was provided. What this means in practice will vary between different types of data. When determining the relevant retention periods, we take into account factors including:
* legal obligation(s) under applicable law to retain data for a certain period of time;
* statute of limitations under applicable law ‚Äì in the UK this is 6 years for a breach of contract claim, which means we may retain certain data for 6 years following the end of our contract with you or the company you represent;
* potential or actual disputes ‚Äì if there is a potential or actual dispute, we will retain the data for a period of time until the dispute is settled; and
* guidelines issued by relevant data protection authorities.
Otherwise, we securely erase your personal data from our systems when it is no longer needed.
**8\. Your rights** You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
**Rights** | **What does this mean?**
---|---
1\. Right of access | You have the right to obtain a copy of your personal data (if we are processing it) and certain other information (similar to that provided in this Privacy Notice). This is so you are aware and can check that we are using your personal data in accordance with data protection law.
2\. Right to rectification | You are entitled to have your personal data corrected if it is inaccurate or incomplete.
3\. Right to erasure | This is also known as ‚Äòthe right to be forgotten‚Äô and, in simple terms, it enables you to request the deletion or removal of your personal data where there is no compelling reason for us to keep using it. This is not a general right to erasure; there are exceptions.
4\. Right to restrict processing | You have the right to ‚Äòblock‚Äô or supress further use of your personal data in certain circumstances. When processing is restricted, we can still store your personal data, but may not use it further.
5\. Right of data portability | You have the right to obtain your personal data in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and to request that we port that data to a third party in certain circumstances.
6\. Right to object to processing | You have the right to object to us processing your personal data for our legitimate business interests and for direct marketing purposes (including in each case any related profiling). In the former case, unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for processing your data which override your interests, we must stop processing it.
7\. Right to withdraw consent to processing | If you have given your consent to us to process your personal data for a particular purpose (for example, direct marketing), you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time (although if you do so, it does not mean that any processing of your personal data up to that point is unlawful).
8\. Right to make a complaint to the data protection authorities | You have the right to make a complaint to the Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office (ICO) if you are unhappy with how we have handled your personal data or believe our processing of your personal data does not comply with data protection law.
**9\. How to contact us** If you would like to exercise your data protection rights or if you are unhappy with how we have handled your personal data, please contact our Nominated Person for Data Protection, Antony Smith via email on [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection).
If you‚Äôre not satisfied with our response to any enquiries or complaint or believe our processing of your personal data does not comply with data protection law, you can make a complaint to the Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office (ICO) by:
* writing to: Information Commissioner‚Äôs Officer, Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire, SK9 5AF;
* calling: 0303 123 1113; or
* submitting a message through the ICO‚Äôs website at: <https://ico.org.uk/concerns/>
**10\. Links to other websites** Our website may contain hyperlinks to websites owned and operated by third parties. This Privacy Notice does not apply to those other websites. We encourage you to read the privacy statements on the other websites you visit, as they will govern the use of any personal data you provide when visiting those websites. We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the privacy practices of such third-party websites and your use of such websites is at your own risk.
**11\. Changes to this Privacy Notice** This Privacy Notice was last updated on 04.11.2025. We may change this notice from time to time by updating this page. You should check this page from time to time to ensure that you are happy with any changes.

top of page
### Zone 1 & 2
ATEX & IECEx Certified Hot Work Habitats
PressureHab‚Ñ¢ Ltd is a globally operating company, providing market-leading certified pressurized hot work habitat solutions.
‚Äã
Our market leading, 3rd party [IEC60079-13](https://webstore.iec.ch/preview/info_iec60079-13%7Bed2.0%7Den.pdf) [ATEX](https://www.pressurehab.com/atex-eu-coc) & [IECEx ](https://www.pressurehab.com/iecex-certificate)certified, pressurized hot work habitat systems provide our partners & customers with market leading economical product. PressureHab systems are engineered to protect people and facilities in hazardous environments where flammable or toxic gases, or other substances, may be present.
PressureHab allows hot work and maintenance to continue without the expense of shutting down large parts of a facility.
Our hot work habitats are used to provide safety and cost savings in a diverse range of industries and locations such as on offshore and onshore oil & gas installations, marine operations, at refineries, chemical processing plants, distilleries, food manufacturing and processing factories, utility and water treatment sites.
PressureHab's pressurized Hot Work Habitat Systems are compact & lightweight, and their innovation and certification surpass all other habitat systems on the market.

# The Danceworks Ballet & Theatre School in Eccles offers elite training in all aspects of dance and musical theatre from early age to advanced level

# Welcome to
**THE DANCEWORKS**
Based in Eccles, Greater Manchester, The Danceworks offers a range of classes covering all aspects of theatre and performing arts.
Whether you want to learn ballet or tap, street dance or singing, we have numerous classes and genres suitable for all children aged 2+
For those wanting to progress through exams, we offer classes in RAD Ballet, ISTD Tap and Modern as well as LAMDA drama exams, advancing up to vocational level. We also offer non-exam classes in a range of dance genres including jazz, contemporary, street and commercial along with gymnastics, singing and piano.
As well as exams, we also have an elite programme for those wanting to pursue a career in the theatre industry. Members of our elite programme regularly take part in a number of competitions locally and nationally. In recent years our students have travelled and competed abroad in the Dance World Cup, achieving multiple medals.
We have had many students advance onto further training and very successful careers. We currently have ex-students performing on Princess Cruises, Costa Cruises and also touring with ‚ÄòJamie the Musical‚Äô.
We pride ourselves on delivering high quality, professional lessons in a fun, nurturing and caring environment. We believe that every child deserves to learn and be the best they can possibly be!

### About Us
Anglia Salads is a privately owned and managed company. It specialises in the production and marketing of lettuce and chicory to the Processed Lettuce Industry, throughout the UK season. The produce supplied ultimately ends up in ready to eat bagged salads, available at all the major supermarkets. Increasingly the company is supplying to the food services sector and to local outlets. To complement lettuce production, large leaf spinach is grown, together with a range of seasonal vegetables.

We were delighted with the result and quality of the finish, which were completed in a professional and timely manner within budget.
I was a delight to have commissioned Craig and welcome the opportunity to recommend his services to others.
N.Goodhew, Sarsden, Oxon
I have known Craig Marles for over 20 years. During this time he has carried out both internal and external painting and decoration work for me, both in a personal capacity and for various property owning clients. He is also capable of carrying out repairs to windows and doors, which is extremely useful when dealing with let properties.
Craig Marles has provided good service over the years and I am confident that our working relationship will continue happily for many years to come.
CJD Bates BA MRICS - Laws and Fiennes (Land Agent and Chartered Surveyors
In my opinion Mr Marles is a competent and professional painter and decorator and he has undertaken a number of contracts for me, both personally and through my business for many clients, over several years. He is capable of a number of styles of decorating and of particular relevancy is his ability to undertake a variety of minor repair works in association with his main business of decorating.
P.J.Cooper FRICS , Souldern, Oxon
Craig Marles has worked for me on internal and external decorations for more than 15 years on many different projects involving painting, paper hanging and carpentry repairs etc. He has been entirely reliable, efficient and conscientcious in all aspects of work. He always finishes the project on time and often goes "The extra mile", he is a pleasure to have around our home and I would heartily recommend his services.
P.Cresswell, Tadmarton, Oxon
Mr Marles made a lovely job of painting the exterior of my house, he had to carry out many repairs to the woodwork and replaced a couple of windows which looked very good indeed on completion. He was very helpful in giving me advice on the colour scheme, although the door colours were my own eccentric choice.
Above all it was very pleasant to have him around, he was friendly and not at all intrusive. Very highly recommended..
V.Newey, Chipping Norton, Oxon

scraped_results.title: Investor Focus Communications - IFC Advisory Limited
scraped_results.markdown_content:
Skip to content
### IFC Advisory
Our mission is to provide a first class advisory and bespoke communications service with a direct focus on the investor, supplemented by an appropriate engagement strategy in the wider market and most importantly, a desire to create real results for our clients.
[ Our Team ](/team/)
##### Investor
Our goal is to provide a first class advisory and bespoke communications service with a direct focus on the investor, supplemented by a good media strategy and more importantly a desire to create results for our clients.
##### Focus
IFC was founded in February 2015 by established public company advisers, Tim Metcalfe and Graham Herring, after identifying the need for a more proactive and focused approach to advising small and mid-cap quoted companies from a financial PR and investor relations perspective.
[ Services ](/services/)
##### Communications
Head-quartered in the City of London, the IFC team provides a unique combination of skills covering corporate finance and financial PR coupled with investor access at both the institutional, and high net-worth and retail level.
## FINANCIAL PR
IFC delivers specialist advice to a number of quoted companies across all sectors including, technology, engineering, consumer, mining and oil & gas. Our tailored approach incorporates strategic insight to suit the requirements of our clients. We partner closely with the companies we advise to provide an all-inclusive, dynamic communications proposition which addresses all aspects of life as a listed business in an ever changing and increasingly regulated market place.
[ More ](/services/)
## INVESTOR RELATIONS
Whether our clients are looking to admit their shares to the public markets or are already on their journey as a public company, IFC provides a quality and in depth advisory service on how best to engage with investors. We specialise in supporting our clients interaction with both the retail and institutional investor markets, helping to increase liquidity and encouraging support.
[ More ](/services/)
## HEADLINES
Keep up to date with the latest client appointments and announcements from IFC.
[ More ](/news/)
